archimate:ApplicationInterface.name: RESTful APIs
archimate:ApplicationInterface.documentation:
Representational State Transfer (REST) is a software architecture style for building scalable web services. An API (Application Programming Interface) expresses a software component in terms of its operations, inputs, outputs, and underlying types.
RESTful APIs conform to the constraints imposed by the REST architectural style by following four basic design principles: use HTTP methods explicitly, be stateless, expose directory structure-like URIs and transfer XML, JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) or both
